meanings.sent1: The scary movie was so unmanning that I couldn't sleep at night.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest had an unmanning effect on the brave explorer.
meanings.sent3: The tiny spider had an unmanning presence on the big, tough dog.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind carried an unmanning message of fear through the village.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder was an unmanning sound that made everyone tremble.

meanings.definition: To cause to lose one's composure or self-control.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected news completely unmanning him in front of his friends.
meanings.sent2: Her sudden outburst unmanning the usually calm teacher.
meanings.sent3: The silly joke about the banana peel almost unmanning the serious businessman.
meanings.sent4: The magician's disappearing act seemed to unmanning the audience's sense of reality.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride was so thrilling, it almost unmanning me with excitement.
